Events that occurred on 20 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1886 – Inkling Charles Williams is born.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 80b.
1947 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 110.
1948 – Author George R. R. Martin is born.
1962 – Cartoonist Bill Amend is born.
1963 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 247.
1982 – Mr. Bliss is published in the UK.
1986 – Oxonmoot 1986 at Oxford Town Hall.
1991 – Oxonmoot 1991 at University College.
1992 – The 1992 radio adaptation of Leaf by Niggle is aired on BBC Radio 5.
1996 – Oxonmoot 1996 at University College.
1997 – Oxonmoot 1997 at Exeter College.
2003 – Oxonmoot 2003 at St Hugh's College.
2013 – Oxonmoot 2013 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2018 - Oxonmoot 2018 at St Antony's College.
2020 - Oxonmoot 2020 held online due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf gains entrance to Edoras and warns them about Saruman. Théoden tells him 'Take any horse, only be gone ere tomorrow is old!'.
Two covered carts leave Bag End for Frodo's new house in Crickhollow. They convey the furniture and goods that Frodo has not sold by way of the Brandywine Bridge.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
